member.name: IOleInPlaceSite.CanInPlaceActivate
member.summary: Determines whether the container can activate the object in place.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success. Other possible return values include the following.

listheader.description: The container does not allow in-place activation for this object.

member.name: IOleInPlaceSite.DeactivateAndUndo
member.summary: Deactivates the object, ends the in-place session, and reverts to the container's saved undo state.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success. Other possible return values include the following.

member.name: IOleInPlaceSite.DiscardUndoState
member.summary: Instructs the container to discard its undo state. The container should not call .

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success. Other possible return values include the following.

member.name: IOleInPlaceSite.GetWindowContext
member.summary: Enables an in-place object to retrieve the window interfaces that form the window object hierarchy, and the position in the parent window where the object's in-place activation window should be located.
member.param: A pointer to an pointer variable that receives the interface pointer to the frame. If an error occurs, the implementation must set ppFrame to NULL.

A pointer to an pointer variable that receives the interface pointer to the document window. If the document window is the same as the frame window, ppDoc is set to NULL. In this case, the object can only use ppFrame or border negotiation. If an error is returned, the implementation must set ppDoc to NULL.
A pointer to a structure for the rectangle containing the position of the in-place object in the client coordinates of its parent window. If an error is returned, this parameter must be set to NULL.

A pointer to a structure for the outer rectangle containing the in-place object's position rectangle (lprcPosRect). This rectangle is relative to the client area of the object's parent window. If an error is returned, this parameter must be set to NULL.
A pointer to an structure the container is to fill in with appropriate data. If an error is returned, this parameter must be set to NULL.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success. Other possible return values include the following.

listheader.description: One or more of the supplied pointers is invalid.

member.name: IOleInPlaceSite.OnInPlaceActivate
member.summary: Notifies the container that one of its objects is being activated in place.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK if the container allows the in-place activation. Other possible return values include the following.

member.name: IOleInPlaceSite.OnInPlaceDeactivate
member.summary: Notifies the container that the object is no longer active in place.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success. Other possible return values include the following.

member.name: IOleInPlaceSite.OnPosRectChange
member.summary: Notifies the container that the object extents have changed.
member.param: A pointer a structure that contains the position of the in-place object in the client coordinates of its parent window.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success. Other possible return values include the following.

member.name: IOleInPlaceSite.OnUIActivate
member.summary: Notifies the container that the object is about to be activated in place and that the object is going to replace the container's main menu with an in-place composite menu.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK if the container allows the in-place activation. Other possible return values include the following.

member.name: IOleInPlaceSite.OnUIDeactivate
member.summary: Notifies the container that it should reinstall its user interface and take focus, and whether the object has an undoable state.
member.param: Specifies whether the object can undo changes (TRUE) or not (FALSE).

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success. Other possible return values include the following.

member.name: IOleInPlaceSite.Scroll
member.summary: Instructs the container to scroll the view of the object by the specified number of pixels.
member.param: The number of pixels by which to scroll in the X and Y directions.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success. Other possible return values include the following.

listheader.description: The specified pointer is not valid.

summary.para: Manages the interaction between the container and the object's in-place client site. Recall that the client site is the display site for embedded objects, and provides position and conceptual information about the object.

This interface provides methods that manage in-place objects. With IOleInPlaceSite, you can determine if an object can be activated and manage its activation and deactivation. You can notify the container when one of its objects is being activated and inform the container that a composite menu will replace the container's regular menu. It provides methods that make it possible for the in-place object to retrieve the window object hierarchy, and the position in the parent window where the object should place its in-place activation window. Finally, it determines how the container scrolls the object, manages the object undo state, and notifies the object when its borders have changed.
